intro: Parosela purpusii, commonly known as the purple parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Parosela purpusii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
